item.title: Spanish verb learning app
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I have made a major overhaul of the app, you can find it here: https://www.jamesmonger.com/conjugator/

The app now functions without reloading the page, all data is loaded via ajax and displayed properly

I have also addressed the UTF-8 issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Spanish verb learning app
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

What is really the motive behind making this web app? Learning PHP/CSS/jQuery/JS/HTML5 or actually making something that can help people with the language. Because right now it seems not very useful.

Do you have any plans to extend this? I’m in the development of my own language app, and I’m a bit curious about how other people would design software for language learning.

For your site it seems like it doesn’t support UTF-8 and thus words with Unicode-encoded characters will not render properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Spanish verb learning app
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:6, topic:550797”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=669710.msg4478192#msg4478192 date=1427582022]
Do you gather the data from some database, or is everything manually typed in?
[/quote]

Unfortunately I couldn’t find any databases with the data that I needed so everything was typed in.

[hr]

Here is the current code:

http://pastebin.com/YjFRKtx7

I’d appreciate any and all feedback![/quote]

After trying it out myself I think you would definitely benefit from preventing page reloads using AJAX. However, if your database is reasonably sized, you can try out the new IndexedDB feature in HTML5 and store your content client-sided. This means you don’t need to poll your server every time.

Read full topic

item.title: Spanish verb learning app
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:4, topic:550797”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=669710.msg4478196#msg4478196 date=1427585735]
Seems kinda slow to reset after getting a right/wrong answer
[/quote]

It reloads the entire page. I need to come up with a more dynamic way of doing it :p[/quote]
AJAX and preloading the words should do the trick.
